us.title: Market Correction Is A Call For Portfolio Correction
us.content: The recent 10% drawdown in the S&P 500 is a healthy, timely correction, offering potential buying opportunities (perhaps) in the less shining corners of the markets. Despite higher credit spreads, they're still within a stable range, not indicating recessionary concerns, actually suggesting a return to normal market conditions.

us.title: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says corrections are 'healthy' and 'normal.' Jim Cramer disagrees
us.content: CNBC's Jim Cramer on Monday parsed recent market action, saying the reason the S&P 500 plummeted into correction territory last week is not typical. "Right now, people are worried about a recession that's caused by the President of the United States," he said.

us.title: One thing to watch as recession fears strike fast-casual restaurant stocks
us.content: Chipotle (CMG) stock is down more than 17% since the start of 2025. Bank of America Securities senior restaurant analyst Sara Senatore joins Market Domination with Julie Hyman and BD8 Capital Partners CEO and CIO Barbara Doran to discuss the stock and explain why she holds a Buy rating for the stock.

us.title: Most business people I stalk to are worried about U.S. dipping into a recession, says Jim Cramer
us.content: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer looks at what is moving the market right now.

us.title: China's Stimulus Push: Wage Hikes, Rate Cuts, and AI-Driven Growth
us.content: Beijing's new economic measures aim to spur consumption, but rising unemployment threatens sentiment. Will China's policy efforts be enough?

us.title: US stocks close higher, Trump focused on tariffs, plus how levies are impacting the supply chain
us.content: Market Domination Overtime anchor Julie Hyman reports on stocks closing higher following last week's sell-off. Next, President Trump's messaging is now focusing more on tariffs than taxes.

us.title: Solana Marks 5-Year Journey – 400 Billion Transactions And Counting
us.content: A well-known cryptocurrency marks its anniversary by celebrating the milestones it has achieved over the years such as its incredible growth that made it one of the top digital assets in the space. In the last five years, Solana has attained nearly $1 trillion in DEX trading and processed more than 400 billion transactions.

us.title: WazirX Relaunches With Zodia Custody Partnership After Security Overhaul
us.content: Indian cryptocurrency exchange WazirX is set to relaunch after a major security breach, partnering with Zodia Custody to enhance asset security and regulatory compliance.

us.title: Cardano Foundation CEO Unveils NASA Collaboration: Details
us.content: Cardano Foundation CEO Frederik Gregaard has confirmed that the blockchain platform is actively collaborating with NASA on data provenance, track and trace solutions, and satellite data applications. Cardano X NASA Collaboration Details Gregaard detailed the scope of the partnership, stating that NASA is utilizing Cardano's blockchain capabilities for data integrity and provenance tracking.

us.title: BYD Shares Touch All-Time High After Unveiling New Charging Tech
us.content: BYD's shares rose in Hong Kong after the Chinese electric vehicle giant unveiled its new fast-charging technology and announced an employee share incentive plan.

us.title: Investor Alert: Robbins LLP Informs Investors of the TFI International Inc. Class Action Lawsuit
us.content: SAN DIEGO , March 17, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Robbins LLP informs stockholders that a class action was filed on behalf of persons and entities that purchased or otherwise acquired TFI International Inc. (NYSE: TFII) securities between April 25, 2024 and February 19, 2025. TFI is a transportation and logistics company that operates in the U.S. and Canada.

us.title: Back-To-Back Gains As Consumers Stay Strong
us.content: After last Friday's spirited bounce, stocks logged another gain today — marking the first back-to-back advance for the S&P 500 since its February 19th record close. The bearish narrative still emphasizes tariff hand-wringing, with investors bracing for the April 2nd reciprocal tariff announcement.

us.title: Jim Cramer on what is behind the recent market uneasiness
us.content: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer looks at what is moving the market right now.

us.title: Pres. Trump: Michelle Bowman will be Federal Reserve Vice Chair of Supervision
us.content: CNBC's Steve Liesman on latest appointment announcement in the Federal Reserve.

france.title: Dine Brands: Cluckin' Around At Rock Bottom
france.content: Dine Brands' promotions like the Really Big Meal Deal failed to significantly boost Applebee's same-store sales, which fell 4.2% year-over-year, extending a seven-quarter losing streak. Despite a strong free cash flow and asset-light model, Dine Brands' revenue and EPS declined, highlighting the need for strategic adjustments and potential debt refinancing. IHOP and Fuzzy's also showed declining same-store sales, with IHOP's House Faves promotion failing to sustain momentum and Fuzzy's underperforming post-acquisition.

france.title: WisdomTree: An Undervalued Growth Play
france.content: WisdomTree's 2024 earnings report shows strong growth with AuM, reaching $114 billion, a 10% YoY increase, and revenues up 21% to $423.7 million. The company achieved significant operating margin expansion due to higher AuMs, cost control, and the retirement of the gold royalty obligation, boosting adjusted net income to $100 million. For 2025, WisdomTree expects continued growth in ETFs and digital assets, with revenues projected at $450 million and net income around $107 million.

france.title: Titanium Transportation Group Reports FY 2024 Financial Results Highlighted by 5% Revenue Growth
france.content: BOLTON, Ontario, March 17, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Titanium Transportation Group Inc. ("Titanium" or the "Company") (TSX:TTNM, OTCQX:TTNMF), a leading provider of transportation and logistics services throughout North America, is pleased to report its financial results for the three-month and fiscal year ended December 31, 2024. All amounts are in Canadian currency.

(NASDAQ: EU) securities between March 28, 2024 and March 2, 2025. EnCore engages in the acquisition, exploration, and development of uranium resource properties in the U.S.     For more information, submit a form, email attorney Aaron Dumas, Jr., or give us a call at (800) 350-6003.

france.title: RBC Capital Previews General Mills' Upcoming Q3 Earnings
france.content:
RBC Capital analysts maintained a Sector Perform rating on General Mills (NYSE:GIS) with a $70 price target, highlighting ongoing challenges in the packaged food industry that could weigh on the company’s near-term performance.

Retailer inventory fluctuations, weak signals from competitors, and broader economic and political uncertainty continue to create a difficult operating environment for General Mills. In light of these pressures, RBC revised its third-quarter (scheduled to be released on March 19) organic growth forecast downward to -3.1%, compared to the consensus estimate of -2.7%. Earnings per share projections remain at $0.96, aligning with market expectations.

With a soft quarter anticipated, RBC suggests full-year organic growth guidance may be revised lower, with earnings likely to hover near the lower end of the current forecast range. The firm expects General Mills to reinforce its cautious outlook, acknowledging the persistent headwinds in the packaged food sector.

While General Mills remains a steady player in the industry, near-term performance is likely to be constrained as consumer uncertainty and market volatility continue to impact demand.

france.title: Investors prepare for FOMC decision and earnings, tariffs could weigh on the consumer
france.content: Yahoo Finance anchor Madison Mills is joined by Bullseye American Ingenuity Fund Portfolio Manager Adam Johnson to discuss growth investing following a big selloff and why this can be a 'wonderful buying opportunity.' Next, why Europe has emerged as a top trade for 2025.

france.title: AES Makes Sense As A Value And Dividend Growth Stock
france.content: AES Corporation had a record-breaking 2024 with strong EPS, yet the stock remains undervalued, presenting a contrarian investment opportunity. The company is heavily investing in renewable energy, which is expected to drive future growth despite current market sentiment and policy concerns. AES offers a solid dividend yield of 5.72%, with consistent annual increases since 2012, making it attractive for income-focused investors.

france.title: Phoenix Group: Delivering Another Year Of Progress
france.content: 2024 will go down as a strong year for U.K. savings business, Phoenix Group. Assets under administration continue to rise despite run-off from its closed-book business, with positive operating leverage driving strong growth in profits and cash generation. Medium-term financial targets have been raised, putting the dividend on an even firmer footing.

france.title: Applied Materials: Massive Share Buyback Is Positive
france.content: I reiterate a 'Buy' rating for Applied Materials with a one-year target price of $196 per share, driven by its strong position in AI and energy-efficient computing markets. AMAT reported 6.8% revenue growth and 9.2% adjusted net income growth, with notable strength in its Semiconductor Systems segment. A new $10 billion share repurchase authorization, on top of $7.6 billion remaining, demonstrates management's confidence and is a positive catalyst for the stock.

france.title: Gauzy: Path To Profitability Is Clearer
france.content: Gauzy's recent earnings reveal strong revenue growth and a clearer path to profitability. Safety Tech's explosive growth showcases their valuable products that improve customer's operational performance. Gross margins still have room to improve due to sales growth propelling stronger economies of scale.
